intro: Oxypetalum capitatum subsp. capitatum, commonly known as the clustered oxypetalum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically produces small, elliptical leaves that are opposite in arrangement. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly found in its natural habitat.
